sn48.53:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
sn48.53:1.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
sn48.53:1.4: “Mendicants, is there a way that a mendicant who is a trainee, standing at the level of a trainee, can understand that they are a trainee? And that a mendicant who is an adept, standing at the level of an adept, can understand that they are an adept?”
sn48.53:2.1: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. …”
sn48.53:2.2: “There is a way that a mendicant who is a trainee, standing at the level of a trainee, can understand that they are a trainee, and that a mendicant who is an adept, standing at the level of an adept, can understand that they are an adept.
sn48.53:3.1: And what is a way that a mendicant who is a trainee can understand that they are a trainee?
sn48.53:3.2: It’s when a mendicant who is a trainee truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
sn48.53:3.3: This is a way that a mendicant who is a trainee can understand that they are a trainee.
sn48.53:4.1: Furthermore, a mendicant who is a trainee reflects:
sn48.53:4.2: ‘Is there any other ascetic or brahmin elsewhere whose teaching is as true, as real, as accurate as that of the Buddha?’
sn48.53:4.4: ‘There is no other ascetic or brahmin elsewhere whose teaching is as true, as real, as accurate as that of the Buddha.’
sn48.53:4.5: This too is a way that a mendicant who is a trainee can understand that they are a trainee.
sn48.53:5.1: Furthermore, a mendicant who is a trainee understands the five faculties:
sn48.53:5.2: faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
sn48.53:5.3: And although they don’t have direct meditative experience of their destination, apex, fruit, and culmination,
sn48.53:5.4: they do see them with penetrating wisdom.
sn48.53:5.5: This too is a way that a mendicant who is a trainee can understand that they are a trainee.
sn48.53:6.1: And what is the way that a mendicant who is an adept can understand that they are an adept?
sn48.53:6.2: It’s when a mendicant who is an adept understands the five faculties:
sn48.53:6.3: faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
sn48.53:6.4: They have direct meditative experience of their destination, apex, fruit, and culmination,
sn48.53:6.5: and they see them with penetrating wisdom.
sn48.53:6.6: This is a way that a mendicant who is an adept can understand that they are an adept.
sn48.53:7.1: Furthermore, a mendicant who is an adept understands the six faculties:
sn48.53:7.2: eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.
sn48.53:7.3: They understand: ‘These six faculties will totally and utterly cease without anything left over. And no other six faculties will arise anywhere anyhow.’
sn48.53:7.4: This too is a way that a mendicant who is an adept can understand that they are an adept.”
